name: Callisto
description: Callisto is one of the four Galilean moons of Jupiter and is the second-largest moon of the planet. It is composed of roughly equal parts of rock and ice and has a heavily cratered surface, indicating little geological activity. Callisto's surface features include impact craters, multi-ring structures, and ancient ridges. It is thought to have a subsurface ocean beneath its icy crust.
rotation_period: Synchronous rotation; same as its orbital period (about 16.69 Earth days)

gallery.description: Enhanced color view of Callisto's surface

interesting_facts: Callisto is one of the four Galilean moons of Jupiter.
It is the second-largest moon of Jupiter.
Callisto is composed of roughly equal parts of rock and ice.
Its heavily cratered surface indicates little geological activity.
Surface features include impact craters, multi-ring structures, and ancient ridges.
Callisto is thought to have a subsurface ocean beneath its icy crust.
Its surface temperature can vary from about -134°C (-209°F) to -220°C (-364°F).
Callisto is tidally locked to Jupiter, meaning the same side always faces the planet.
It has a thin atmosphere composed mainly of carbon dioxide.
Callisto has been studied by spacecraft such as Voyager and Galileo, providing valuable data about its composition and surface features.
